Name: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria
Info: Family-owned local chain for Italian classics & Chicago-style, deep-dish pizzas with butter crusts.

Name: Bar Louie
Info: Upbeat grill chain with American grub, martinis & microbrews, plus happy-hour deals.

Name: HERO Coffee Bar
Info: Coffee shop with pour-over java drinks & farm-to-table sandwiches in a funky setting.

Name: The Berghoff Restaurant
Info: Institution since 1898 serving traditional German cuisine & steins of beer in an old-world setting.

Name: Willis Tower
Info: Iconic, 110-story skyscraper featuring expansive views of Chicago from its 103rd-story Skydeck.

Name: Kitty O’ Sheas
Info: Traditional bar featuring Irish pub fare, beer, wine & live entertainment inside the Hilton Chicago.

Name: 2Twenty2 Tavern
Info: Bourbon, craft beer & pub snacks offered in lofty, sleek digs with shuffleboard & live music.

Name: Dollop Coffee Co.
Info: Coffee drinks, sandwiches, local pies & pastries in a cozy space with bookshelves & free WiFi.

Name: Intelligentsia Coffee Monadnock Coffeebar
Address: Monadnock Building, 53 W Jackson Blvd, Chicago, IL 60604
Info: High-end coffee bar chain serving daily roasted brews in an industrial-chic setting.

Name: Millennium Park
Info: 24.5-acre green space with a video display, the reflective "Bean" sculpture & an outdoor theater.

Name: Hilton Chicago
Info: Sleek rooms have modern decor and custom-designed beds, plus flat-screens and free Wi-Fi; some provide lake views. Executive rooms offer access to a lounge serving free breakfast and evening appetizers. Suites add separate living areas.

Name: Umai
Info: Sushi bar & Japanese standards, plus a full bar, in an airy, loftlike room. Delivery available.

Name: HI Chicago Hostel
Info: The modern, single-sex dorms feature wooden bunk beds, shared or en suite bathrooms, and free Wi-Fi. Towels and linens are included. Private rooms are also available.

Name: Buddy Guy's Legends
Info: Classic blues club with up-and-coming & famous acts 7 nights a week plus New-Orleans-inspired grub.

Name: The Blackstone
Address: 636 South Michigan Avenue, E Balbo Dr, Chicago, IL 60605
Info: Sophisticated rooms (some with lake views) offer flat-screens TVs, iPod docks and Wi-Fi (fee), as well as minifridges and coffeemakers. Club rooms provide access to a lounge with free continental breakfast and snacks. Suites add separate living spaces, and some have fireplaces. Room service is available.

Name: Wildberry Pancakes & Cafe
Info: Pancakes & other big portions of American eats draw hungry folks to this breakfast-lunch cafe.

Name: Ohio Street Beach
Address: 600 N Lake Shore Dr, Chicago, IL 60611
Info: North-facing sandy public beach on Lake Michigan, a popular swimming option with city skyline views.

Name: Peet's Coffee
Info: Berkeley-born chain featuring signature coffee, tea & blended drinks alongside baked goods.

Name: Chicago Architecture Center
Info: The Chicago Architecture Center (CAC) is the city’s new all-in-one architecture experience: a museum with two floors of fascinating exhibits and a gateway to more than 85 awe-inspiring boat, walking, bus, bike and L tours!

Name: Yolk
Info: Cafe chain serving creative breakfast dishes & sandwiches in a cheery, contemporary atmosphere.

Name: The Congress Plaza Hotel
Info: Elegant rooms come with free Wi-Fi, coffeemakers and cable TV; suites add separate living rooms with dining tables and sitting areas. Some rooms and suites have views of Lake Michigan, and marble bathrooms with whirlpool tubs.

Name: Chicago Riverwalk
Info: Riverside pedestrian path featuring city views & dining, plus bridges, fishing piers & boat docks.

Name: Navy Pier
Info: Former Navy training center draws crowds with carnival rides, restaurants, shops & fireworks.

Name: Starbucks
Info: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
